name: Data Engineer
description:
Do you want to join a pioneer company in the field of computer vision, spatial computing and AI/DL technology with a team of developers with diverse experience and enjoy a creative work environment?

Join Occipital, Inc. (USA), makers of Canvas - a mobile app for 3D scanning homes - which was just featured in Apple’s own keynote about the iPhone 12 Pro as a significant example of what you can do with its new LiDAR sensor.

About this position

In short, Canvas is bringing 3D capture to the world of home improvement. We combine our cutting-edge computer vision expertise with Apple’s new LiDAR sensor to help architecture, design, and renovation companies measure and digitize homes in a fraction of the time it used to take, using everyday mobile devices, and now experiencing a surge of growth due to the proliferation of devices with embedded 3D sensing.

Structure Sensor Pro is a 3D scanning device bringing unparalleled accuracy and performance in body scanning to many areas of healthcare, such as orthotics and prosthetics.

As a data engineer at Occipital, you will join an established infrastructure team in building a next-generation data architecture to support the growth of all areas of our business as our data needs scale. Our data operation has a lot of surface area (computer vision tech, human-in-the-loop internal operations, customer-facing web portals, app interfaces, and e-commerce), and supports complex business operations, so you will touch a wide variety of products and tools. Your work will directly help Occipital as it scales to reach thousands of architecture, design, renovation, and healthcare companies to save time and grow their business with 3D capture.

This role will involve a healthy mix of ETL, data warehousing, data analytics, and tool development, so it is ideal for someone who likes variety in the type of projects they work on

Technical requirements

  • At least 2 years of professional work experience in ETL and data warehousing

  • At least 2 years of professional experience working with SQL on Postgres and/or Google BigQuery

  • Experience in systems design. You will be heavily involved in designing the architecture of our future data operations

  • Experience working with Python

Non-technical requirements

  • An ability to internalize the needs of the stakeholder, and proactively in the gaps they may not know about. You are not expected to be a product designer, but the ability to make and justify implementation decisions with our internal customers in mind is essential

  • Strong overall communication skills. We are a high-communication team, so you’ll be expected to share progress frequently, raise blockers and concerns proactively, and operate autonomously

  • Good spoken and written English is a must, with the majority of communication being written

Pluses (or will need to learn in this position)

  • E-commerce or SaaS accounting data experience is a very strong plus

  • Experience with Django is a very strong plus

We offer

  • Official employment in full accordance with labor law
  • Stock options in the US company
  • Flexible working hours, no bureaucracy
  • A cozy office in the center of Moscow (Shabolovskaya subway station)
  • Health insurance program, meals compensation and other benefits
  • Access to the newest devices and prototypes for developers (3D cameras, phones, etc.)
  • Business trips to the US

Location

This position is based in our Moscow R&D center, but remote work is also possible
